author: Reuters Editorial
title: Crosby's OT tally lifts Penguins past Islanders
text:
Sidney Crosby scored with 72 seconds left in overtime, lifting the Pittsburgh Penguins to a 3-2 victory over the visiting New York Islanders on Saturday at PPG Paints Arena.
Crosby helped the Penguins break a three-game losing streak by finishing off a two-on-one rush with defenseman Justin Schultz. Once Schultz gained possession, he fed Crosby, who was racing down the right wing.
Crosby gained the puck in the right circle and deked goaltender Christopher Gibson. Crosby then fired a slap shot under the goalie’s pads as New York defenseman Adam Pelech was hesitant in providing coverage.
It was Crosby’s 22nd goal of the season and the 34th of his career against the Islanders.
Patric Hornqvist and Derick Brassard scored for the Penguins, who rebounded from an 8-4 loss at Boston on Thursday.
Tristan Jarry made 25 saves, including two in overtime during an Islanders power play when the Penguins were called for too many on the ice.
Defenseman Brandon Davidson and Anders Lee scored for the Islanders, whose losing streak reached a season-high six games.
Gibson made a career-high 47 saves in his fifth career NHL appearance. He became the third Islanders rookie to face at least 50 shots, and moments before the game ended, Gibson made a point-blank stop on Crosby.
The Islanders took a 2-1 lead 4:59 into the third when Tavares made a strong individual effort, diving head first for a loose puck and moving toward Lee. Lee poked it into the net off Pittsburgh defenseman Jamie Oleksiak and under Jarry’s blocker for his 31st goal.
Pittsburgh tied the game when Brassard converted Phil Kessel’s cross-ice feed with 8:31 remaining in regulation. Brassard was alone in front of Gibson and simply backhanded the puck into the net for his 19th goal.
The Islanders took a 1-0 lead 71 seconds into the game on an odd play. Davidson was attempting to backhand a pass for Lee but the puck went under Jarry, who lost his balance and fell down attempting to make the save.
The Penguins tied the game with 1:56 remaining in the second period after Cal Clutterbuck was whistled for boarding. Kessel started a rush up the ice, got the return pass from Evgeni Malkin and whipped a backhand pass from the left circle to Hornqvist, who blew by Brock Nelson and put the shot under Gibson’s legs.
—Field Level Media
